abstract: The records examined by The New York Times — as the freeze on military aid was playing out — shows that some officials were pursuing the question of burden-sharing.
lead_paragraph: President Trump’s lawyer, Pat A. Cipollone, opened the defense arguments by  saying that the Trump administration’s hold on military assistance to Ukraine — which was fighting a Russian-backed incursion on its eastern border — was driven by the president’s belief that other nations were not doing their share in supporting the former Soviet republic.
